summary: This document is a series of emails from August 2019 between FBI personnel and others coordinating the logistics and planning for the execution of a search warrant on Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James (LSJ), near St. Thomas. It details efforts to secure lodging, transportation, personnel, and equipment, and references coordination with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The target of the investigation; the planned search warrant is for his private island, Little St. James.

persons.name: Herrick
persons.context: Mentioned as having concurred with the framework for the island search warrant plan.

connections.description: Herrick, as FBI personnel, is involved in planning the investigative search of Epstein's property.

events.title: SDNY drafting affidavit for LSJ search
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York is drafting the affidavit for the search warrant for Little St. James Island, aiming to have it sworn out later in the week.

events.title: Initial planning for Epstein island search
events.description: FBI personnel discuss securing probable cause for a search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's island, anticipating execution within the next 30 days.

events.title: Logistics coordination for island search
events.description: FBI teams coordinate lodging at Sugar Bay Resort, transportation via CBP, and personnel/equipment needs for the upcoming search operation on Little St. James.

events.title: Planned FBI team deployment to St. Thomas
events.description: An FBI team is scheduled to go down to St. Thomas on Thursday to begin advance work for the island search.

keyFacts: The FBI and SDNY were actively planning a search of Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James, in early August 2019.
Logistics were complex due to post-hurricane conditions on St. Thomas, requiring coordination for lodging, boat transport, and significant amounts of water.
The planned search was anticipated to be substantial, involving 15-20 buildings on the island, based on Google imagery.
The warrant affidavit was being drafted by SDNY, with the goal of having it sworn out on or around August 8, 2019.
The document references a previous search of Epstein's NYC residence that yielded 845 pictures and took 13 hours, setting a precedent for the scale of the island operation.
